context_of_use: The power user executes bulk updates or actions across multiple records to improve efficiency.
stakeholders_and_interests: power user: Improve efficiency in handling multiple records.
description: Execute bulk updates or actions across multiple records to improve efficiency.
triggering_event: The power user initiates a request to perform bulk operations.
preconditions: The power user is logged into the system.
The power user has the necessary permissions to perform bulk operations.
postconditions: The system successfully executes the bulk operations.
The records are updated as specified by the power user.
assumptions: The power user has access to the necessary data for bulk operations.
The system supports bulk operations functionality.
requirements_met: The system shall allow the power user to perform bulk operations on records.
The system shall ensure that bulk operations are executed efficiently.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the types of records that can be bulk updated.
main_flow: 1. power user initiates a request to perform bulk operations → system acknowledges the request.
2. power user specifies the records and actions for the bulk operation → system validates the input.
3. system executes the bulk operations → system confirms successful completion to the power user.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If the input is invalid, the system displays an error message and prompts the power user to correct the input.
information_for_steps: 2. Records and actions specified by the power user.
